meanings.sent1: The cloth was madid after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The grass felt madid with dew in the early morning.
meanings.sent3: The madid towel slipped from the clothesline and landed in a puddle.
meanings.sent4: The air was so madid that it felt like walking through a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The madid earth soaked up the rain like a thirsty sponge.

meanings.sent1: Her hands were madid from washing dishes all day.
meanings.sent2: The cake was madid with delicious chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent3: The madid dog shook off water all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The madid leaves glistened in the sunlight after the rain.
meanings.sent5: The madid swimsuit clung uncomfortably to her skin.

meanings.sent1: The basement always felt madid and musty.
meanings.sent2: The madid air made it hard to breathe during the heatwave.
meanings.sent3: The madid bathroom mirror fogged up after a hot shower.
meanings.sent4: The madid forest was alive with the sounds of insects.
meanings.sent5: The madid climate of the jungle enveloped them like a warm blanket.
